recipe.recipe_name: Low-Sodium Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream
recipe.ingredients: - coconut milk (full-fat): 2 cans (13.5 ounces each) - fresh mint leaves: 1 cup - honey: 1/3 cup - vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon - dark chocolate chips (sugar-free, if preferred): 1/2 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Infuse Mint: In a saucepan, combine the coconut milk and fresh mint leaves. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then remove from heat and let steep for 30 minutes. Strain the mixture, discarding the leaves, and cool completely in the refrigerator. 2. Mix Base: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the cooled mint-infused coconut milk, honey, and vanilla extract until well combined. 3. Churn: Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions. 4. Add Chocolate Chips: When the ice cream is almost solid, add the dark chocolate chips and continue churning until mixed thoroughly. 5. Freeze: Transfer the ice cream to an airtight container and freeze until firm, about 3-4 hours. 6. Serve: Enjoy your homemade low-sodium mint chocolate chip ice cream.
